Package clap

Class Manager

java.lang.Object
clap.Manager
public final class Manager extends Object
The main class of the Command Line Argument Parser organizes other parts.

    • areArgumentsParsed

      public boolean areArgumentsParsed()
      Returns whether the arguments are parsed.
      Returns:
      true if arguments are parsed, false otherwise

    • getHelp

      public String getHelp()
      Generates a documentation of the specified arguments.
      Returns:
      helpful documentation of the arguments

    • parseArguments

      public void parseArguments() throws ArgumentException
      This function parses program arguments and stores results in argument instances. Only single parsing is allowed. It can be called by other functions.
      Throws:
      ArgumentException - If parsing has already been performed.

    • makeArgument

      public <T extends SimpleArgument> ArgumentBuilder<T> makeArgument(Class<T> type) throws ArgumentException
      Commences a creation of a new argument.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the argument
      Parameters:
      type - Runtime representation of the argument type
      Returns:
      Argument builder for specification of a new argument
      Throws:
      ArgumentException - If the argument does not have an expected constructor.

    • isNameUnique

      public boolean isNameUnique(String name)
      Checks if a name is not already defined.
      Parameters:
      name - potential name to be tested
      Returns:
      false if the name is already used, true otherwise
